results.title: Imprint = L'Empreinte
results.creator_credit: Henri Lacam, Jacques Armand Cardon and International Film Promotions
results.brief_description: Animated philosophical tale about the moulding of children into a social pattern. Futuristic piece which suggests that society will consist of two classes - the rulers and the ruled. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Imprint = L'Empreinte
results.brief_description: A social and philosophical fable about a little boy who has a plank fastened to his back. The day it is taken off is a day of great relief. The boy then discovers that his body bears the mark of a shoe sole and heel.
results.description: A social and philosophical fable about a little boy who has a plank fastened to his back. The day it is taken off is a day of great relief. The boy then discovers that his body bears the mark of a shoe sole and heel.

results.title: Impression of Oakleigh Technical School. . a caring place
results.brief_description: An overview of Oakleigh Technical School as seen throught the eyes of Scott, one of the students. The school is show as having a vibrant school council with an innovative, stimulating program.

results.brief_description: Can an Elephant jump? Watch it try as it avoids the deadly spears as it gathers the keys to get to the next level.

results.title: Imperial city
results.creator_credit: David Rowan, Margaret Williams and Arbor Films
results.brief_description: In 1911, the British built a new capital for India. The creation of New Delhi was the greatest artistic enterprise of the British Empire, and we follow the architects in a search for a style incorporating British and Indian architecture.
results.creator_credit_for_label: David Rowan, Margaret Williams and Arbor Films

results.title: Immortal image
results.brief_description: Examines the sculpture of Ukrainian-born artist Leo Mol and follows his technique, the lost wax method, as he creates a portrait in bronze. Includes comments by the artist.

results.title: Imagination 10
results.creator_credit: Morton Goldscholl, Champion Papers and Morton Goldscholl Design
results.brief_description: This film pays tribute to the railroad and its contribution to America; discusses the type of life and work of the people who run the passenger and freight trains. Shows the aesthetic appeal of steel and steam and the beauty of nature along the right of way and is almost an abstract painting seen from a parlour car window, a montage of people. The film was prepared in conjunction with the publishing of a monograph on a variety of papers used by the railroads.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Morton Goldscholl, Champion Papers and Morton Goldscholl Design

results.title: Il Est Minuit, Docteur Schweitzer
results.brief_description:
This biopic of Albert Schweitzer follows the young graduate of Medical school all the way to Gabon where he sets up a dispensary with the help of nurse Marie Winter. Their effort are interrupted with the onset of World War I as Albert realises he is a German citizen established in a French colony. See also: ‘Le Grand Blanc de Lambarene’(NLA #2108812, VHS).

Credits: Producer, Georges Bernier ; director, Andre Haguet ; writers, Andre Haguet, Henri-Andre Legrand ; photography, Lucien Joulin ; music, Maurice-Paul Guillot.
Cast: Pierre Fresnay, Jeanne Moreau, Raymond Rouleau, Jany Vallieres, Jean Debucourt.

results.title: Ikebana: Japanese art of flower arrangement
results.brief_description: Ikebana is the Japanese art of flower arrangement which is now known throughout the Western world. The history, principles and theory of this type of flower arrangement are told.

results.title: If you loved me
results.creator_credit: Gerald T Rogers and Modern Talking Pictures
results.brief_description: A drama about a family’s struggle with alcoholism. Focuses on the role and responsibility of family members and friends and offers guidance in dealing with the problem.
